title.narrative: IR 1.7 GOUVERNANCE DU SECTEUR EAH (WASH)

description.narrative: R 1.7: National, provincial and local Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) governance structures can effectively manage and scale-up sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) results, which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: CHILD SURVIVALPCR1: By end 2018, the proportion of children, newborns, families who benefit from high health impact quality interventions, including HIV Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission (PMTCT), nutrition, and water - sanitation - hygiene (WASH ) increases significantly and fairly, particularly in health sub-divisions and communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: R 1.7: National, provincial and local WASH governance structures can effectively manage and scale-up sustainable WASH results

description.narrative: The national and provincial level coordination and governance bodies were supported and strengthened in 2019 to effectively operationalize the 2018-2022 plan for the Health Schools and Villages Programme that was finalized in 2018 through the development of the National Roadmap for Water and the National Roadmap for the Eradication of Open Defecation. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020

title.narrative: Sectoral approach (SWAp) to rural WASH is in place.[Approche sectorielle (SWAp) dans le secteur du EAH rural est en place.](22826)
